organization.fullName: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

leadSponsor.name: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to understand how the pressure in the pulmonary artery changes under different conditions of posture, respiration and exertion.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This is a prospective, multi-center, observational study with enrollment up to 30 subjects at 2 U.S. sites. All study data can be collected on a single day as a one-time visit (lasting approximately 90-120 minutes).

This study is a Non-Significant Risk (NSR) Investigational Device Exemption (IDE) study as LINQ™ HF investigational RAMware is required to activate additional sensors in the Reveal LINQ ICM.

The patient will come to the clinic for a single in-office visit. PA pressure will be measured while the patient is in a variety of positions and during different respiratory exercises and after brief exertion. Data will be collected on eCRFs.

The effects of the different postures, respiration and exertion will be quantified using descriptive statistics (mean, standard deviation).

armGroups.label: All participants
armGroups.description: All participants enrolled in a single arm to evaluate effect of variables (posture, respiration, exertion) on pulmonary artery pressure (PAP)
interventionNames: Other: Reveal LINQ ICM Cardiac Monitor, taped on the subject's chest rather than inserted in the body.

interventions.name: Reveal LINQ ICM Cardiac Monitor, taped on the subject's chest rather than inserted in the body.
interventions.description: Cardiac Monitor with LINQ™ HF Investigational RAMware download
otherNames: Interventions included: Changing posture, changing respiration, and changing exertion

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mean Change in Pulmonary Artery Pressure (PAP) Due to Change in Posture
primaryOutcomes.description: Posture defined as lying left side down compared to baseline supine
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Same day as enrollment (during office visit, maximum of 30 minutes after baseline masurement)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in PAP During Change in Respiration
secondaryOutcomes.description: Outcome measure defined as PAP during coughing compared to PAP during normal breathing respiration at baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Same day as enrollment (during office visit, maximum of 30 minutes after baseline measurement)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in PAP as Measured After Mild Exertion Compared to Initial Baseline PAP at Rest.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Same day as enrollment (during office visit, maximum of 10 minutes after baseline measurement)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Investigator believes the patient's condition is sufficiently stable to safely participate in the study procedures
* Subject is currently implanted with a commercially available pulmonary artery pressure sensor and device communication has been reliable (recent history of successful communications with patient communication system)

Exclusion Criteria:

* Subject has a history of primary PAH

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Change in Pulmonary Artery Pressure (PAP) Due to Change in Posture
outcomeMeasures.description: Posture defined as lying left side down compared to baseline supine
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Only 14 patients able to provide data to contribute to analysis.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Same day as enrollment (during office visit, maximum of 30 minutes after baseline masurement)

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in PAP During Change in Respiration
outcomeMeasures.description: Outcome measure defined as PAP during coughing compared to PAP during normal breathing respiration at baseline.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Same day as enrollment (during office visit, maximum of 30 minutes after baseline measurement)

analyses.pValueComment: Pressure during coughing versus normal breathing initially measured at baseline.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in PAP as Measured After Mild Exertion Compared to Initial Baseline PAP at Rest.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Same day as enrollment (during office visit, maximum of 10 minutes after baseline measurement)

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: All-Cause Mortality, Serious, and Other (Not Including Serious) Adverse Events were not monitored/assessed
adverseEventsModule.description: All-Cause Mortality, Serious, and Other (Not Including Serious) Adverse Events were not monitored/assessed.
